header: Hezekiah Shows the Babylonians His Treasures(A)

verse: At that time Baladan’s son, King Merodach Baladan of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah. He had heard that Hezekiah had been sick and had recovered.

Hezekiah was so happy with them that he showed the messengers his warehouse: the silver, gold, balsam, fine olive oil, his entire armory, and everything in his treasury. Hezekiah showed them everything in his palace and every corner of his kingdom.
Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah and asked, “What did these men say? And where did they come from?”
Isaiah asked, “What did they see in your palace?”
Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of Yahweh Tsebaoth!
Yahweh says, ‘The days are going to come when everything in your palace, everything your ancestors have stored up to this day, will be taken away to Babylon. Nothing will be left.
Some of your own descendants will be taken away. They will become officials in the palace of the king of Babylon.’”
Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “Yahweh’s word that you have spoken is good.” He added, “Just let there be peace and security as long as I live.”
